question:
(a) (i) Draw a well labelled diagram to show the internal structure of the earth
(ii) Describe the distinguishing characteristics of any one of the layers shown in your diagram

(b) Outline the importance of either the hydrosphere or the biosphere to man
answer:
(a)(i) Internal structure of the Earth

(ii) Characteristics of the crust:

(i) It is made up of upper part to form the continent

(ii) It is made up of granite and contains minerals like silicon and aluminum hence called SIAL

(iii) Its density is 2.7

(iv) It also contains the lower part to form the ocean floor

(vi) It is made up of basalt rocks and contains minerals like silicon, iron and magnesium hence called SIMA

(vi) It has a density of 3.0

(b) Importance of hydrosphere to man include:

(i) Hydrosphere provides water for domestic and industrial uses

(ii) It also provides means of transportation

(iii) It provides food, e.g fish

(iv) It can help to generate electricity (H.E.P)

question:
(a) On an outline map of Nigeria, locate and name
(i) an inland drainage basin
(ii) a delta
(iii) a man-made lake
(iv) a confluence town

(b) In what four ways can physical factors limit the use of rivers for transportation in Nigeria?

(c) How can these limitations be overcome?
answer:
(b) Four physical factors limiting the use of rivers for transportation include:

(i) Presence of waterfall and rapids

(ii) Problems of water weed

(iii) Fluctuating volume of water due to seasons

(iv) Short length of rivers

(c) The above problems can be overcome by

(i) Construction of dams

(ii) Continuos clearing of water weeds

(iii) Dredging of rivers

(iv) Construction of canal

question:
(a) Draw an outline map of Nigeria and on it, show and name
(i) the savanna belts and one important town in each of the belts

(b) Highlight three vegetation characteristics of any one of the savanna belts shown on your map

(c) Describe the relationship between vegetation and rainfall in the savanna belts. Give reasons for any three of the following in Nigeria
answer:
(b) Characteristics of Guinea Savanna; 

(i) Presence of tall trees

(ii) Presence of tall grasses

(iii) Trees shed their leaves during the dry season

(iv) Trees found include locust beans, shea-butter 

(c) Relationship between the rainfall and vegetation in the Savanna include:

(i) Rainfall decreases from the Guine2 Savanna towards the Northern limit

(ii) Rainfall duration is longer in the Guinea Savanna than the Sahel Savanna

(iii) Little rainfall of between 20cm - 7cm in the Sahel leads to stunted growth of trees

(iv) Arrival of rainfall marks the beginning of the grasses in the savanna.

question:
(a) On an outline map of Nigeria, locate and name the; 
(i) North-Central Highlands, Western Highlands, Adamawa Highlands and Udi Hills
(ii) Rivers Sokoto, Gongola, Oshun and Anambra

(b) Describe four ways in which the North-Central Highlands are of economic importance

(c) Highlight any four problems limiting the economic development of the region
answer:
(b) Four economic importance of North-Central Highlands include

(i) Presence of mineral deposits e.g tin and columbite

(ii) Rearing of cattle

(iii) Source of many rivers

(iv) Provision of hard rocks for construction

(c) Four problems limiting the economic development of the region include:

(i) Presence of rugged terrain

(ii) Inadequate rainfall

(iii) Soil erosion problem

(iv) Scattered settlements

question:
(a) On an outline map of Nigeria locate and name:
(i) the Eastern Highlands, Eastern Scarp lands and Chad Basin
(ii) one important river in each region
(iii) one important town in each region

(b) Describe the Eastern Highlands under the following headings:
(i) population and settlement
(ii) natural resources
(iii) economic activities.
answer:
(b)(i) Population and settlement of Eastern Highlands 
-The area is sparsely populated
-Population density is between 20 - 100 persons/ km2
-It has dispersed settlements

(ii) Natural Resources
(a) Presence of minerals
(b) Presence of waterfalls
(c) Presence of highlands

(iii) Economic Activities
(a) Crop farming 
(b) Animal rearing
(c) Mining activities

question:
(a) Draw an outline map of West Africa and on it show and name:
(i) any three member countries of the ECOWAS
(ii) the capitals of the countries shown

(b) Outline any three objectives of the ECOWAS

(c) Explain three factors that have limited the full attainment of these objectives
answer:
(b) Three objectives of the ECOWAS include: 
(i) Increased trade between member countries 
(ii) Free movement of goods, services, and people 
(iii) Promote cooperation and development in economic activities

(c) Three factors limiting the attainment of the objectives include:
(i) Language barrier
(ii) Strong colonial ties
(iii) Similarity of economic activities.

question:

(i) the Fouta Mallon Highlands and the Cameroun Highlands
(ii) one important river that takes its source from each highland
(iii) one important inland drainage basin
(iv) one artificial lake (v) one lagoon coast

(c) Describe any three major characteristics of the coastline of Africa
answer:
(b) Three importance of river basins include:
(i) It provides good sites for settlement
(ii) It is suitable for agricultural purposes
(iii) Presence of rivers serves as communication routes

(c) Three characteristics of the Coastline of Africa include
(i) They have few indentation
(ii) It has some estuaries e.g Togo
(iii) It may have delta coast, e.g Nile, Niger
